body: this seems to fail only on php 7: https://travis-ci.org/yiisoft/yii2/builds/138698808

Might be related to this:

https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=69659

It looks like running isset over a property that needs to go through __get() forces the __isset() magic method to be called first on the ServiceLocator class (it used to be __get() followed by __isset(). Tested with 7.0.4, before this bug was noticed by the PHP team and I'm able to get the test by @cebe to pass).
This is a BC break in PHP: https://3v4l.org/jEUfg

in the PHP bug [69659](https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=69659), nikic wrote:

> For reference, the way to fix any issues with this change is to make sure your __isset() or 
> offsetExists() functions behave correctly. If this change causes issues with your code, it indicates that 
> you already have a broken __isset/offsetExists implementation, but it's brokenness did not 
> previously surface (one bug canceling another...)

this means the semantics of `__isset()` in yii's service locator component are questionable.
it will return true [only if the component is already loaded](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/65232792b9c7ba32c66d1e85be5532bc4acee614/framework/di/ServiceLocator.php#L79), even though `__get()` would load it afterwards if it will be called. Fixing this would need a BC break however it seems like a reasonable fix to me even for 2.0.x. @yiisoft/core-developers opinions?
I vote for the fix: `__get()` and `__isset()` should be consistent.
I'm for fixing it but we should measure before/after performance and take a good look at tests we have...

> we should measure before/after performance

In normal flow performance will not be affected. Framework does not ever call `isset()` over `ServiceLocator`. Only custom developer code may be affected.
the only difference will be one more call to isset() inside of `__isset()` there should not be any change in performance.

issue.title: Consistent behavior for ServiceLocator::__isset()

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
Fixed semantics of `yii\di\ServiceLocator::__isset()` to match the behavior of `__get()` which fixes inconsistent behavior on newer PHP versions

fixes #11771
